intro: Hesperis limprichtii var. violacea, commonly known as the purple sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a compact, bushy habit. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long bloom period and ability to attract pollinators.
